thread.title: Numbers Don’t Lie: Fox News Is No. 1 For Eighth Straight Month
thread.title_full: Numbers Don’t Lie: Fox News Is No. 1 For Eighth Straight Month

author: Scott Kelnhofer
title: Numbers Don’t Lie: Fox News Is No. 1 For Eighth Straight Month

organizations.name: liberal blogger for hit piece on former co-host

text:
Hannity Lashes Out At Liberal Blogger For Hit Piece On Former Co-Host 
According to Nielsen Media Research , Fox News was not only the top-ranked cable news network, it was No. 1 in total prime time viewership, and No. 1 in total day (measuring the 24 hours from 6 a.m. – 6 a.m.) viewership. 
That marks eight consecutive months FNC has generated more total day viewers than any other basic cable network — a record for Fox News. 
The network saw its total viewership increase 31 percent from January and 39 percent from Feb. 2016. Advertisement - story continues below 
In prime time, Fox News averaged 2.9 million viewers. MSNBC ranked fourth among all cable networks in prime time with slightly fewer than 1.5 million viewers. CNN was 11th with 1.18 million viewers. 
In total day viewership, Fox News averaged 1.76 million viewers. CNN was fourth with an average of 850,000 viewers, while MSNBC was sixth with an average of 804,000. 
And while being the most-watched network is always a measure of success, being the most watched network during one of the key “sweeps” months is very good for a network’s bottom line. 
“Sweeps” months — February, May, July and November — are the months in which ratings are captured both electronically and, in smaller markets, via paper diaries. Rating performance during sweeps months are used to set advertising rates by the various networks. Advertisement - story continues below
